title: Introduction to Ethical Hacking
introduction: Ethical hacking, also known as penetration testing or white-hat hacking, is the process of identifying and fixing security vulnerabilities in computer systems and networks.
details: Ethical hackers use the same techniques as malicious hackers to identify weaknesses in security defenses and report them to the organization for remediation. They help organizations strengthen their cybersecurity measures and protect against potential threats. Learning about ethical hacking involves understanding different hacking techniques, vulnerability assessment, and penetration testing methodologies.
